00065 void MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::declareMetrics()
00066 {
00067   // These were declared "uninformative" and should no longer be reported.
00068   //declareMetric(m_Label+"_AT_median",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00069   //declareMetric(m_Label+"_GC_median",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00070   //declareMetric(m_Label+"_median_diff_over_iqr",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00071   declareMetric(m_Label+"_DQC",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00072   declareMetric(m_Label+"_log_diff_qc",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00073   declareMetric("saturation_GC",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00074   declareMetric("saturation_AT",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00075 }
00076 
00077 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00078                                                                      QCProbesetOptions& psOpts,
00079                                                                      ChipLayout* layout,
00080                                                                      std::string label) :
00081   m_ProbeSets(probeSets),
00082   m_psOpts(psOpts),
00083   m_layout(layout),
00084   m_Label(label),
00085   m_cel (NULL)
00086 {
00087   m_K = 2.0;
00088   declareMetrics();
00089   Verbose::out(2, "Initializing Dish QC Okay!");
00090 }

00095 void
00096 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::newChip(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData* cel)
00097 {
00098   // remember the pointer for later.
00099   m_cel=cel;
00100   //
00101   m_CelNames.push_back(cel->GetFileName());
00102 
00103   // Get Contrast Values
00104   vector<double> ATcontrastValues;
00105   vector<double> GCcontrastValues;
00106   // Get LogDiff values
00107   vector<double> ATLogDiffValues;
00108   vector<double> GCLogDiffValues;
00109 
00110   vector<double> ATSaturationValues;
00111   vector<double> GCSaturationValues;
00112 
00113   // Vincent Bressler 11/15/2012
00114   //vector<float> intensities;
00115   //double sat_gc = 0;
00116   //double sat_at = 0;
00117 
00118   //{
00119          // int n = cel->GetNumCells ();
00120          // intensities.resize (n);
00121          // int check = cel->GetIntensities (0,intensities); // GC is channel 0
00122          // int nsat = 0;
00123          // for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00124          // {
00125                 //  if (intensities[i] >= 3800)
00126                 //        nsat++;
00127          // }
00128 
00129          // sat_gc = (double)nsat / (double)n;
00130   //}
00131 
00132   //{
00133          // int n = cel->GetNumCells ();
00134          // cel->GetIntensities (1,intensities); // AT is channel 1
00135          // int nsat = 0;
00136          // for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00137          // {
00138                 //  if (intensities[i] >= 3800)
00139                 //        nsat++;
00140          // }
00141 
00142          // sat_at = (double)nsat / (double)n;
00143   //}
00144   
00145   //need to edit here to change the contrast
00146   GimmeContrast(m_ProbeSets,
00147                 ATcontrastValues, GCcontrastValues,
00148                 ATLogDiffValues,  GCLogDiffValues,
00149                                 ATSaturationValues, GCSaturationValues,
00150                 m_K);
00151 
00152   Verbose::out(4, "AT nonpolymorphic probeset size is: " + ToStr(ATcontrastValues.size()));
00153   Verbose::out(4, "GC nonpolymorphic probeset size is: " + ToStr(GCcontrastValues.size()));
00154 
00155   Verbose::out(4, "calculate new log diff score");
00156   double atLogDiffScore, gcLogDiffScore, logDiffQC ;
00157   calcLogDiff(ATLogDiffValues, atLogDiffScore);
00158   calcLogDiff(GCLogDiffValues, gcLogDiffScore);
00159   logDiffQC = atLogDiffScore + gcLogDiffScore;
00160 
00161   CumulativeStats<double> GCstats;
00162   CumulativeStats<double> ATstats_full;
00163   CumulativeStats<double> GCstats_full;
00164 
00165   double nonOverlap = calcNonOverlap(ATcontrastValues, GCcontrastValues, GCstats);
00166   
00167   // difference between median / avg IQR
00168   //double medianDiff = calcMedianDiff(ATcontrastValues, GCcontrastValues, GCstats_full, ATstats_full);
00169   int chipIdx=getNextChipIdx();
00170   setMetric(chipIdx,m_Label+"_DQC"                 , nonOverlap);
00171   //setMetric(chipIdx,m_Label+"_median_diff_over_iqr", medianDiff);
00172   //setMetric(chipIdx,m_Label+"_AT_median"           , ATstats_full.getMedian());
00173   //setMetric(chipIdx,m_Label+"_GC_median"           , GCstats_full.getMedian());
00174   setMetric(chipIdx,m_Label+"_log_diff_qc"         , logDiffQC);
00175   setMetric(chipIdx,"saturation_GC"       , GCSaturationValues[0]);
00176   setMetric(chipIdx,"saturation_AT"       , ATSaturationValues[0]);
00177   setValid(true);
00178 }

00188 /**
00189  * Go thru GC contrast values and find the mean and stdev
00190  * go thru AT contrast values and count how many are within 2stdev of GC mean
00191  * calculate the fraction of non-overlap
00192  * @param ATcontrast Values
00193  * @param GCcontrast Values
00194  * @param GCstats vector to fill in with stats
00195  */
00196 double
00197 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::calcNonOverlap(const std::vector<double> &ATcontrastValues,
00198                                                   const std::vector<double> &GCcontrastValues,
00199                                                   CumulativeStats<double>  &GCstats)
00200 {
00201   for(int gcIx = 0; gcIx < GCcontrastValues.size(); gcIx++) {
00202     float intensity = GCcontrastValues[gcIx];
00203     GCstats.addData(intensity);
00204   }
00205   float gc_mean = GCstats.getMean();
00206   float gc_stdev = GCstats.getStdev();
00207 
00208   float gcthreshold = gc_mean + 2*gc_stdev;
00209   int inGC = 0;
00210 
00211   for (int atIx = 0; atIx< ATcontrastValues.size(); atIx++){
00212     if (ATcontrastValues[atIx] < gcthreshold){
00213       inGC++;
00214     }
00215   }
00216 
00217   double result = (double) inGC / int(ATcontrastValues.size());
00218   Verbose::out(4, "in GC fraction is " + ToStr(result));
00219   result = 1.0-result;
00220   return result;
00221   
00222 }
00223 
00224 
00225 /**
00226    * Go thru one channel's contrast values and calculate the fraction 
00227    * of probesets above or under given threshold.
00228    * @param contrastValues for a given channel
00229    * @param threshold to decide boundary
00230    * @para greater: count number of probeset greater than threshold or not
00231    */
00232 double MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::calcCrossThreshold(const std::vector<double> &contrastValues,
00233 double threshold, bool greater ) {
00234     int cnt = 0;                
00235     if(greater){
00236         for (int ix = 0; ix< contrastValues.size(); ix++){
00237              if (contrastValues[ix] > threshold){
00238                 cnt++;
00239             }
00240         }
00241   }
00242    else{
00243         for (int ix = 0; ix< contrastValues.size(); ix++){
00244            if (contrastValues[ix] < threshold){
00245               cnt++;
00246            }
00247         }
00248   }
00249   
00250   double result = (double) cnt/ contrastValues.size();
00251   Verbose::out(4, "cross threshold fraction is " + ToStr(result));
00252   return result;
00253 }
00254 
00255 void MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::calcLogDiff(std::vector<double> &logdiffValues, double &avg, double &score, double &IQRS){
00256   CumulativeStats<double> values;
00257   values.setFull();
00258   if(logdiffValues.size() == 0){
00259         Err::errAbort("Empty logdiffvalues.");
00260   }
00261   for(int idx = 0; idx < logdiffValues.size(); idx++) {
00262     double logdiff = logdiffValues[idx];
00263     values.addData(logdiff);
00264   }
00265   values.setUpFullMethod();
00266   avg = values.getMean();
00267   double diff_std = values.getStdev();
00268   double IQR = values.getIQR();
00269   if(diff_std == 0 || IQR == 0){
00270     Err::errAbort("No variance or inter quantile rangefor sample.");
00271   }
00272   score = avg/diff_std;
00273   IQRS = avg/IQR;
00274   
00275 }
00276 
00277 void MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::calcLogDiff(std::vector<double> &logdiffValues, double &score){
00278   CumulativeStats<double> values;
00279   values.setFull();
00280   if(logdiffValues.size() == 0){
00281         Err::errAbort("Empty logdiffvalues.");
00282   }
00283   for(int idx = 0; idx < logdiffValues.size(); idx++) {
00284     double logdiff = logdiffValues[idx];
00285     values.addData(logdiff);
00286   }
00287   values.setUpFullMethod();
00288   double avg = values.getMean();
00289   double diff_std = values.getStdev();
00290   if(diff_std == 0){
00291     Verbose::out(4, "No variance range for sample. Something wrong, please check.");
00292     score=-100;
00293   }
00294   else{
00295     score = avg/diff_std;
00296   }
00297 }

00300 /**
00301    * Go thru GC contrast values and find the median and IQR
00302    * go thru AT contrast values and find the median and IQR
00303  * calculate the abs(GC_median - AT_median) / average_IQR
00304  * @param ATcontrast Values
00305  * @param GCcontrast Values
00306  *
00307  */
00308 double
00309 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::calcMedianDiff(const std::vector<double> &ATcontrastValues,
00310                                                   const std::vector<double> &GCcontrastValues,
00311                                                   CumulativeStats<double> &ATstats,
00312                                                   CumulativeStats<double> &GCstats)
00313 {
00314   GCstats.setFull();
00315   ATstats.setFull(); //use full method
00316 
00317   for(int gcIx = 0; gcIx < GCcontrastValues.size(); gcIx++) {
00318     float intensity = GCcontrastValues[gcIx];
00319     GCstats.addData(intensity);
00320   }
00321   for(int atIx = 0; atIx < ATcontrastValues.size(); atIx++) {
00322     float intensity = ATcontrastValues[atIx];
00323     ATstats.addData(intensity);
00324   }
00325   GCstats.setUpFullMethod();
00326   ATstats.setUpFullMethod();
00327 
00328   double gc_median = GCstats.getMedian();
00329   double gc_IQR = GCstats.getIQR();
00330   double at_median = ATstats.getMedian();
00331   double at_IQR = ATstats.getIQR();
00332   double result = abs (gc_median - at_median) / ((gc_IQR + at_IQR)/2);
00333   //double gc_mean = GCstats.getMean();
00334   /*Verbose::out(4, "gc_median is " + ToStr(gc_median));
00335     Verbose::out(4, "at_median is " + ToStr(at_median));
00336     Verbose::out(4, "gc_IQR is " + ToStr(gc_IQR));
00337     Verbose::out(4, "at_IQR is " + ToStr(at_IQR));
00338     Verbose::out(4, "gc_mean is " + ToStr(gc_mean));
00339 
00340     Verbose::out(4, "medianDiff is " + ToStr(result));
00341   */
00342   return result;
00343 
00344 
00345 }

00361   /// @todo why is this done?
00362 }

00364 /**
00365  * Add a new probeset subset via a mask associated with identifier name.
00366  *
00367  * @param name - string identifier associated with this mask (i.e. "all", "pm")
00368  * @param mask - bit mask with probesets to calculate stats for set to true.
00369  */
00370 void MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::addProbeMask(const std::string &name, const std::vector<bool> &mask)
00371 {
00372   m_MaskNames.push_back(name);
00373   m_ProbesetMasks.push_back(mask);
00374 }
00375 
00376 void MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::readSampleAlleleMap(const std::string& filename,
00377                                                             std::map<std::string,std::vector<int> >& sampleAlleleMap)
00378 {
00379   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00380   Verbose::out(1, "reading channel-file: "+filename);
00381 
00382   std::string probeset;
00383   int alleleA, alleleB;
00384 
00385   tsv.bind(0, "probeset_name",    &probeset, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00386   tsv.bind(0, "allele_A_channel", &alleleA,  affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00387   tsv.bind(0, "allele_B_channel", &alleleB,  affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00388 
00389   if (tsv.open(filename)!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00390     APT_ERR_ABORT("Could not open channel-file: '" + filename + "'");
00391   }
00392 
00393   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00394     //printf("channel: '%s' %d %d\n",probeset.c_str(),alleleA,alleleB);
00395     sampleAlleleMap[probeset].push_back(alleleA);
00396     sampleAlleleMap[probeset].push_back(alleleB);
00397   }
00398   tsv.close();
00399   printf("channel: read %d items\n",int(sampleAlleleMap.size()));
00400 }
00401 
00402 void
00403 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::GimmeContrast(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00404                                                  std::vector<double>& ATcontrastValues,
00405                                                  std::vector<double>& GCcontrastValues,
00406                                                  std::vector<double> &ATLogDiffValues, 
00407                                                  std::vector<double> &GCLogDiffValues,
00408                                                                                                  std::vector<double> &ATSaturationValues,
00409                                                                                                  std::vector<double> &GCSaturationValues,
00410                                                  double k)
00411 {
00412   std::string fileName=m_cel->GetFileName();
00413   std::string fileNameRoot=Fs::basename(fileName);
00414 
00415   Verbose::out(1, "computing contrast for '"+fileName+"' in MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::GimmeContrast");
00416 
00417   ATcontrastValues.clear();
00418   GCcontrastValues.clear();
00419   ATLogDiffValues.clear();
00420   GCLogDiffValues.clear();
00421 
00422   // Construct the analysis streams for each factory
00423   AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory;
00424   AnalysisStream*       asStream;
00425 
00426   ///
00427   std::map<std::string,std::vector<int> > sampleAlleleMap;
00428   if (m_psOpts.m_channelFile!="") {
00429     readSampleAlleleMap(m_psOpts.m_channelFile,sampleAlleleMap);
00430   }
00431   else {
00432     //Verbose::out(1,"No channel file. Assuming allele A on channel A and allele B on channel B.");
00433     Verbose::out(1,"No channel file. Taking channel info from probesets.");
00434   }
00435 
00436   if (m_psOpts.m_sketchInFile!="") {
00437     asFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(m_psOpts.m_sketchInFile);
00438   }
00439   asStream=asFactory.constructAnalysisStream(m_psOpts.m_exprAnalysisString,*m_layout);
00440 
00441   std::vector<std::string> celFiles;
00442   celFiles.push_back(fileName);
00443 
00444   SparseMart* sMart=NULL;
00445   sMart=new SparseMart(m_layout->getProbeLayoutOrder(),
00446                               celFiles,
00447                               true);
00448 
00449   CelReader cReader;
00450   cReader.registerStream(asStream->getChipStreamHead());
00451   cReader.registerIntensityMart(sMart);
00452 
00453   // Setup the MultiChannelQuantMethod
00454   MultiQuantMethodListener multiQuant;
00455   QuantMethodReportListener* listener = new QuantMethodReportListener();
00456   listener->registerListener(&multiQuant);
00457   asStream->addReporter(listener);
00458 
00459   // Dummies needed by the reporter
00460   PmOnlyAdjust pmAdjust;
00461   //ChipStream * iTrans;
00462 
00463   //populate Chipstreams and pmAdjusters by taking advantage of analysisStream object
00464   std::vector<ChipStream*>* cStream;
00465   PmAdjuster* pmAdjuster;
00466   cStream=asStream->getChipStream();
00467   pmAdjuster=asStream->getPmAdjuster();
00468 
00469   // Read in cel files
00470   // we could just call readFiles() on each cReader, but if there are
00471   // cross dependencies between the channels, this will not work. For example
00472   // if there is a chip stream node in one channel which corrects for cross
00473   // talk and thus needs values from an earlier step in all the other channels */
00474   cReader.setFiles(celFiles);
00475   cReader.readFiles();
00476 
00477   GCSaturationValues.resize (celFiles.size ());
00478   ATSaturationValues.resize (celFiles.size ());
00479   for (int ifile=0; ifile<celFiles.size (); ifile++)
00480   {
00481           GCSaturationValues[ifile] = cReader.GetSaturationValue (ifile*2);
00482           ATSaturationValues[ifile] = cReader.GetSaturationValue (ifile*2+1);
00483   }
00484 
00485   // Loop through all of our probe sets and do an expression quantification for each one.
00486   // @todo: perhaps here is a place to kick in the QCprobesetOptions
00487 
00488   // Verbose::progressBegin(1,"Processing probesets",
00489   // 40, (int)(layout.getProbeSetCount()/40), layout.getProbeSetCount());
00490 
00491   ProbeSet m_Aallele;
00492   ProbeSet m_Ballele;
00493 
00494   //int jhg_cnt=0;
00495 
00496   for (int psIx = 0; psIx < probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00497     // Verbose::progressStep(1);
00498     ProbeSet* ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(probeSets[psIx]);
00499     ProbeSetGroup group(ps);     // psGroup should delete the memory for ps...
00500 
00501     // Verbose::out(4, "processing probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00502     asStream->doAnalysis(group, *sMart, true);
00503 
00504     fillInAlleleProbeSets(*ps, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00505 
00506     ///@todo much of this should probably be in a MultiQuantLabelZ
00507     ///      rather than using QuantLabelZ directly. Accessing
00508     ///      m_Results directly is ugly as well.
00509 
00510     // Figure out the channels for this SNP
00511     // @todo default should be global (ie if we have a channel file,
00512     // then all probesets must be found in it. only default to 0/1 when there is no channel file)
00513     //int alleleAindex = 0;
00514     //int alleleBindex = 1;
00515 //    if (sampleAlleleMap.find(ps->name) != sampleAlleleMap.end()) {
00516 //      alleleAindex = sampleAlleleMap[ps->name][0];
00517 //      alleleBindex = sampleAlleleMap[ps->name][1];
00518 //    }
00519 //    else if () {
00520 //    }
00521 //    else {
00522 //      alleleAindex = 0;
00523 //      alleleBindex = 1;
00524 //      Verbose::out(1,"Unable to find probeset '" + ToStr(ps->name) + "'"
00525 //                   " in channel file. Assuming channels 1 and 2.");
00526 //    }
00527 
00528     bool success = true;
00529     std::vector<double> Asignals;
00530     std::vector<double> Bsignals;
00531 
00532     if ((asStream->getQuantMethod()) == NULL) {
00533       Err::errAbort("missing quantMethod...");
00534     }
00535 
00536     // A
00537     success=summarizeAllele(&m_Aallele,
00538                             Asignals,
00539                             *sMart,
00540                             cStream,
00541                             *pmAdjuster,
00542                             asStream->getQuantMethod(),
00543                             true);
00544     if (!success) {
00545       Err::errAbort("problem with at MultiChannelNonOverlapLoCelListener::summarizeAllele. "
00546                     "Cannot succesfully summarize value for A allele.");
00547     }
00548     // B
00549     success = summarizeAllele(&m_Ballele,
00550                               Bsignals,
00551                               *sMart,
00552                               cStream,
00553                               *pmAdjuster,
00554                               asStream->getQuantMethod(),
00555                               true);
00556     if (!success) {
00557       Err::errAbort("problem with at MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::summarizeAllele. "
00558                     "Cannot succesfully summarize value for B allele.");
00559     }
00560 
00561     //
00562     double contrast = -2, strength = -2;
00563     ContrastExtremesStretch(k, Asignals[0], Bsignals[0], contrast, strength);
00564     // iterate thru the number of masks, usually just AT and GC
00565     for (int m = 0; m<m_ProbesetMasks.size(); m++){
00566       string probesetclass = m_MaskNames[m];
00567       double logDiff=0.0;
00568       if (m_ProbesetMasks[m][psIx] == true && probesetclass.compare("AT") == 0){
00569         ATcontrastValues.push_back(contrast);
00570         logDiff=log(Asignals[0]/Bsignals[0]); 
00571         ATLogDiffValues.push_back(logDiff);
00572       }
00573       else if (m_ProbesetMasks[m][psIx] == true && probesetclass.compare("GC") == 0){
00574         GCcontrastValues.push_back(contrast);
00575         logDiff =  log(Bsignals[0]/Asignals[0]);                                                              
00576         GCLogDiffValues.push_back(logDiff);                                                                   
00577       }
00578    }
00579     //Verbose::out(1,"SIGNALS:"+ToStr(ps->name)+":"+
00580     //ToStr(Asignals[0])+":"+ToStr(Bsignals[0])+":"+ToStr(contrast));
00581     //
00582     // clear out results for the current probeset
00583     m_Aallele.clear();
00584     m_Ballele.clear();
00585     multiQuant.m_Results.clear();
00586 
00587     //
00588     //if (jhg_cnt++>100) {
00589     //  break;
00590     //}
00591   }
00592   //  Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00593   
00594   //
00595   delete asStream;
00596   delete sMart;
00597 }
00598 
00599 bool
00600 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::summarizeAllele(ProbeSet* pSet,
00601                                                    vector<double>& summaryValues,
00602                                                    SparseMart& sMart,
00603                                                    std::vector<ChipStream *>* iTrans,
00604                                                    PmAdjuster& pmAdjust,
00605                                                    QuantMethod* quantMethod,
00606                                                    bool lowPrecision)
00607 {
00608   bool success = true;
00609   QuantExprMethod *qeMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(quantMethod);
00610   summaryValues.clear();
00611   /* This is a little interesting as we are spoofing a probeSetGroup for calling
00612      functions but don't want the destructor called while that group thinks it
00613      owns those probesets. */
00614   ProbeSetGroup group(pSet);
00615   //int probesize = group.countPmProbes();
00616   //int probesetsize = group.probeSets.size();
00617   //Verbose::out(4, "countPmProbes() is " + ToStr(probesize));
00618   //Verbose::out(4, "group.probeSets.size() is " + ToStr(probesetsize));
00619   if(!qeMethod->setUp(group, sMart, *iTrans, pmAdjust))
00620     success = false;
00621   else {
00622     qeMethod->computeEstimate();
00623 
00624     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < qeMethod->getNumTargets(); i++) { //for each metaCelFile
00625       double val = qeMethod->getTargetEffect(i); //get signal intensities of the pSet
00626       if(lowPrecision) {
00627         val = Util::round(val);
00628       }
00629       summaryValues.push_back(val);
00630     }
00631     success = true;
00632   }
00633 
00634   /* clear out probesets to prevent deleting them. */
00635   group.probeSets.clear();
00636   //clearProbeSet(*pSet);
00637   pSet->clear();
00638   return success;
00639 }
00640

00642 bool
00643 MultiChannelNonOverlapCelListener::fillInAlleleProbeSets(const ProbeSet &gtPs,
00644                                                          ProbeSet &aAllele,
00645                                                          ProbeSet &bAllele)
00646 {
00647   aAllele.clear();
00648   bAllele.clear();
00649     
00650   // First set up the probe sets to do the summarization of a and b alleles.
00651   aAllele.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00652   bAllele.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00653 
00654   // Set the names for our spoofed probesets with suffix A and B
00655   string ps_name = gtPs.name;
00656   aAllele.name = Util::cloneString(ps_name.c_str());
00657   bAllele.name = Util::cloneString(ps_name.c_str());
00658 
00659   //int groupOffset = 0; // atoms are stored in blocks for each allele, keep track of which block we're in.
00660   /*  Verbose::out(4, "ProbeSet::Aforward Areverse Bforward Breverse are "
00661       + ToStr(ProbeSet::Aforward) + ", " + ToStr(ProbeSet::Areverse) + ", " + ToStr(ProbeSet::Bforward)
00662       + ", " +ToStr(ProbeSet::Breverse));
00663   */
00664   //Verbose::out(4, "numGroups for " + ToStr(gtPs.name) + " is " + ToStr(gtPs.numGroups));
00665   //for(unsigned int groupIx = 0; groupIx < gtPs.numGroups; groupIx++) {
00666   //Verbose::out(4, "atomsPerGroup for " + ToStr(groupIx) + " is " + ToStr(gtPs.atomsPerGroup[groupIx]));
00667   //assuming one one group
00668 
00669   // single atom from an old spf file.
00670   if (gtPs.atoms.size()!=1) {
00671     APT_ERR_ABORT("The probeset '"+ps_name+"' has "+ToStr(gtPs.atoms.size())+" blocks. (should be 1)");
00672   }
00673   for(unsigned int atomIx = 0; atomIx < gtPs.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00674     // Duplicate the single block onto the two alleles
00675     // use Atom::deepCopy to avoid messing with the memory management of ProbeSets.
00676     Atom* a;
00677     //
00678     a=Atom::deepCopy(*gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00679     aAllele.atoms.push_back(a);
00680     aAllele.atoms[atomIx]->channel_code=1;
00681     a=NULL;
00682     //
00683     a=Atom::deepCopy(*gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00684     bAllele.atoms.push_back(a);
00685     bAllele.atoms[atomIx]->channel_code=0;
00686     a=NULL;
00687   }
00688   
00689   return true;
00690 }

00693 //    // walk the atoms, putting them on the correct alleles.
00694 //    for(unsigned int atomIx = 0; atomIx < gtPs.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00695 //      // split the blocks onto seperate probesets.
